rules: Don't add `@using MudBlazor` into .razor files.
if you add T='SomeDto' to a MudBlazor component and the using clause is required in the .razor to compile, add it.
Favour reusing existing backing methods to fetching data.
When generating MudBlazor code, always use the official enum values for parameters like AlignItems, Size and Justify (e.g., AlignItems.Center, Justify.SpaceBetween) instead of raw strings.

For Validation, ensure the lambda/method matches Func<T, IEnumerable<string>>. If T is a reference type (like string), use a nullable parameter (string? v). If T is a value type: Use the nullable form (int? v) or (DateTime? v) if the field can be empty. Use the non-nullable form (int v) only if the field must always have a value.
Don't adding using clauses which are already in the _Imports.razor.
When adding using clause, add them in the right place i.e stick to the convention in the file.
For MudBlazor generics like MudChipSet, MudSelect, MudRadioGroup, MudSwitch declare T explicitly.
When generating MudBlazor components inside conditional Razor blocks, always set the generic T explicitly.
If you are binding to a input component which expects a nullable type, like MudSelect or MudDatePicker update the backing model field to be nullable.
If you are add multiple forms to isolate validations, make sure they are not nested inside one another.
In Razor pages use foreach statements rather than for statements.
If you add Dense, Variants or Margins to Form Controls do it consistently across the form controls.

templates.name: Page - Search Entity
rules: if you implement LoadServerData it must have 2 parameters (TableState state, CancellationToken cancellationToken)
Only add row actions and buttons like Add, View, Edit and Delete, if there are existing methods in the razor.cs code behind which represent them like AddEntity, EditEntity, Delete Entity etc.
Only add search criteria is they are supported on the backing page search mechanism
if you add scripts like this, OnKeyPress set to @(async e => { ... }), if there are quotes in the lambda function don't escape them with backslashes
Always add placeholders to search criteria input controls

templates.name: Dialog - Add Entity
rules: use IMudDialogInstance not MudDialogInstance in the razor.cs
use these tags <TitleContent><DialogContent><DialogActions> not the old tags like <MudDialogTitle><MudDialogContent><MudDialogActions>
MudBlazor DialogResult has a Canceled property not Cancelled
